message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS

This paper proposes a new algorithm for topic modeling that uses semantic information captured via high-dimensional distributed word embeddings. This technique is particularly useful for identifying key topics in user-generated content, such as emails and chats, where topics are diffused across the corpus. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

The paper also mentions that the proposed algorithm works equally well for non-user generated content, such as papers and reports, which suggests that it could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. 

Furthermore, the use of distributed word embeddings is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence, which makes the sub-categories cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely as well. 

Finally, the paper presents a new algorithm that outperforms existing techniques, which could also make it relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
